circumstances:
The aircraft left RAF Waltham at 2039LT bound to Essen, Germany. While approaching the Dutch coast, the aircraft was shot down by the German Flak. The left engine failed, a generator went out of service and a part of the hydraulic system failed as well. As the aircraft was losing height, the captain ordered three of his crew to bail out and he attempted to make an emergency landing when the aircraft went out of control and crashed in flames in a prairie. As the three crew who bailed out were rescued and became POW, the three crew in the aircraft were killed.
Crew (12th Squadron):
P/O R. H. Buchanan, pilot,
Sgt P. G. Sanders, copilot, †
Sgt R. A. Scragg, navigator, †
Sgt H. M. Murdo, air gunner, †
Sgt R. A. Arnold, air gunner, 
Sgt C. J. Chedd, wireless operator.
probable_cause: Shot down by the German Flak.
